lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.

1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/duke.duke.task.task.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.duke.task.task.Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
* Loads the contents from existing file.
* Deals with making sense of the user command.
* Reads and executes the user commands accordingly.
* @throws NumberFormatException If there exist a missing field for done and delete commands.
* @throws IOException When unable to save the file.
* Deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file.
* Reads the file duke.txt, if exists, and outputs the contents in the list.
* If file does not exists, a new file is created.
* @param file The file which is read.
System.out.println("No existing file found, new file is created");
* Writes all task data into file, duke.txt in a readable format.
* @param instruction The tasks in the list are written into the file.
* @throws IOException if an error occurs during writing to file.
public static void writeToFile(ArrayList<Task> instruction) throws IOException {
public static ArrayList<Task> instruction = new ArrayList<>();
* Prints out all tasks currently in the list.
System.out.println("Here are the task(s) in your list:");
//this wil first check instruction.get(i) and see if its a Deadline/Event/tdo
// and then print out the toString() method of the respective Deadline/event/tdo class
* Prints out the tasks that has the matching keyword.
* @param keyword Checks if the description of each task in the list matches.
System.out.println("Here are the matching task(s) in your list:");
* Adds in the tasks to the list upon reading from file duke.txt.
* @param task Task read from file duke.txt.
* Adds a new Todo type task to the list.
* Calls a function to display the task added.
* Adds a new Deadline type task to the list
* Extracts out the task description and task Date.
* Calls a function to display the task added.
* Adds a new Event type task to the list
* Extracts out the task description and task Date.
* Calls a function to display the task added.
* Prints out the task that user sets as Done.
* Checks if task number is correctly entered by user.
* @param instructNum Identifies which task is completed.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If instruction number does not exist in the list.
instruction.get(instructNum - 1).markInstructionAsDone(); // because instruction is data type Task
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
//this wil first check instruction.get(instructNum -1) and see if its a Deadline/Event/tdo
// and then print out the toString() method of the respective Deadline/event/tdo class
System.out.println(instruction.get(instructNum - 1).toString()); // because instruction is data type Task
* Prints out the task that user wants to Delete.
* Checks if task number is correctly entered by user.
* Prints out the remaining number of task/s left in the list.
* @param instructNum Identifies which task is deleted.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If instruction number does not exist in the list.
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task: \n" + "\t" + instruction.get(instructNum - 1).toString());
System.out.println("Now you have " + instructionIndex + " task in the list");
System.out.println("Now you have " + instructionIndex + " tasks in the list");
* Prints out the task which is added to the list.
* Prints out the updated total number of task/s in the list.
* @param task The task which is added.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: \n" + "\t" + task.toString());
System.out.println("Now you have " + instructionIndex + " task in the list");
System.out.println("Now you have " + instructionIndex + " tasks in the list");
* Calls function to write data into file after "bye" command is entered by user.
* @throws IOException if writing to file fails.
public static void saveData() throws IOException {
* Deals with interacting with the user.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?\n");
* Prints out the commands and format that are accepted by Duke.
System.out.println("Bye. All instructions have been saved. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints out when user inputs delete command after all instructions
* have already been deleted from the list.
* Prints out when user inputs done command before any instructions are added into the list.
* Prints out when user inputs an invalid instruction number during done or delete command.
System.out.println("Instruction number does not exist. Please try again!");
* Prints out when the value is missing for a done or delete command.
System.out.println("The task you input has missing fields!");
* Prints out if user presses the Enter key without any inputs.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description cannot be empty!");
* Prints out if user incorrectly enters a command which Duke does not support.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Checks if user have correctly entered the description of ToDo.
* Subsequently calls a function which adds the task into an ArrayList.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Checks if user have correctly entered the description of deadline.
* Subsequently calls a function which adds the task into an ArrayList.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
* Checks if user have correctly entered the description of event.
* Subsequently calls a function which adds the task into an ArrayList.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.");
* Checks if user have correctly entered the description of find.
* Subsequently, extract out the keyword and call a function which executes the find command.
System.out.println("The description of find cannot be empty.");
* Prints out if there is an error in saving the file.
System.out.println("Unable to save data, please try again!");
* Prints out if there is an error in reading the values from the .txt file.
System.out.println("Error reading value, skipping to next line.");
System.out.println("Removed corrupted instruction. Please add again.");
* Print out if entire file is corrupted and unable to load into the application.
//class Deadline inherits methods/attributes from class Task
* Override the outputs specific to task type Deadline.
super(description); //it is passing description into Task(String description){} HAS TO BE IN A CONSTRUCTOR
// it takes the value from super.toString which is "[" + getStatusIcon() + "] " + description;
* Override the outputs specific to task type Event.
// String description: this is received from Deadline/Event/Tdo constructor
//description is really just what is the task: eg. buy bread, project meeting etc
// this is just the skeleton that's why its abstract
* Override the outputs specific to task type Todo.
